required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: To Look at the Characteristics of Synovial Fluid and Cartilage Matrix in Osteoarthritic Knee After Hyaluronic Acid Injection
clinical_study.official_title: Quantifications of Biochemical Changes of Synovial Fluid and Cartilage Matrix in Osteoarthritic Knee After Hyaluronic Acid Injection Using Novel MRI (Magnetic Resonance Imaging) and NMR (Nuclear Magnetic Resonance) Techniques

primary_outcome.measure: To Identify Imaging Markers for Characterizing the Biochemical Profiles in Synovial Fluid and Cartilage in Knee OA After HA Injection
primary_outcome.description: The study will demonstrate the feasibility of using MRI and NMR techniques to quantify biochemical changes in synovial fluid and cartilage matrix in OA knees after HA injection.

secondary_outcome.measure: To Quantify Synovial Fluid Biochemical Changes Using High Field HRMAS NMR Spectroscopy

other_outcome.measure: To Quantify Cartilage Matrix Changes Using MR T1p ad T2 Mapping at 3T MRI

arm_group.description: EUFLEXXAÂ® is a hyaluronate hydrogel produced from bacteria, in a phosphate-buffered saline solution. It is given as a three week treatment regimen. It involves injecting of 2cc or 20mg intra-articularly once per week.

intervention.description: Euflexxa will be injected weekly for 3 consecutive weeks on the knee joint.
MRI of the knee will be acquired during baseline (a week prior to the treatment), follow up visit 1 (1 week after treatment) and follow up visit 2 (3 months after treatment).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 18 to 80 years
- Symptomatic knee OA as defined by the American College of Rheumatology criteria
- Kellgren-Lawrence grade I, II or III on prior x-rays (take within 6 months of screening visit)
- knee pain score >40 mm on a 100 mm visual analogue scale for > 15 days in the last month
- NSAIDs permitted if the dose has been stable for at least one month prior to baseline and stays stable during the study
- Have been recommended for Euflexxa treatment by physician
- Knee effusion based on clinical exam or imaging
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any contraindication to MRI (pregnancy, metallic fragments in the eyes, vascular clips, Pacemakers etc)
- History of knee replacement
- Known sensitivity or allergy to any component of Euflexxa
- Inflammatory arthritis
- Previously received viscosupplementation therapy within 6 months of study enrollment
- Intra-articular injection of corticosteroid to study joint within the past 3 months
- Arthroscopic or open surgery within the previous 12 months or planned surgery to the study joint
- Concomitant medications of oral/parenteral corticosteroids
- Morbid obesity defined as body mass index (BMI) >40 kg/m2
- Active malignancy; an active systemic infection; recent high impact or high energy trauma (clinically defined) to the study joint
- Large knee effusion based on clinical exam or imaging

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: To Identify Imaging Markers for Characterizing the Biochemical Profiles in Synovial Fluid and Cartilage in Knee OA After HA Injection
outcome.description: The study will demonstrate the feasibility of using MRI and NMR techniques to quantify biochemical changes in synovial fluid and cartilage matrix in OA knees after HA injection.
outcome.population: The PI left institution and all efforts to locate outcome measure data have been exhausted and therefore cannot be reported.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
